Text.Value: Calm yourself - we have allies on the surface. Seek them out, and play this lyre to call on their guide.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: stows the moon lantern back where he kept it

EditorData.logicalname: If player interacted with elevator already

Text.Value: Explain that the Absolute is a front for mind flayers - you're protected from them.
The General resides at Moonrise Towers, but you cannot simply travel there. The land surrounding the Towers is blighted by a deadly curse.
When the General entrusted me with this mission, he warned there may be some damage caused by a monster let loose in the temple.
I will tear your heart from your chest. And I will hear Her voice again.
I - never mind. Go to the General at Moonrise. There's little time to waste.
It's true - it's a shadowy conspiracy headed by mind flayers and... tax collectors.
The favourite. Nothing is done in these lands without his knowledge.
No, it's not true - you're here to test my faith. And I will not fail.

EditorData.NodeContext: Last sentence grim and determined - about to attack

Text.Value: I was abducted by mind flayers. That was when I began to hear the Absolute.
Impossible. I should slit your throat for speaking such blasphemy.
Dying for a cause is one thing, but for a mind flayer? For filth like that? No.
Minthara already offered to help me.
You don't have to. Run - abandon the Absolute.
I'm not risking a curse for you, the General, or anyone else.
I can still reach the temple and fulfil the General's orders. His advisor, Balthazar, also sought a way.
Perhaps you're right. Perhaps I should.
I am generous to those who aid him. When I return to Moonrise, I will be triumphant, and you will share in my victory.
No - the General will understand that none of this was my fault. He will understand, because you will tell him.

EditorData.NodeContext: Uncertain that the General will understand

Text.Value: Whatever it is, I'll set it right. I'll cut you down in Her name!
You worthless, treacherous little rats.
Your faith in Lolth faltered. It is not too late to reclaim it.
Yes, I bet you're feeling pretty stupid right now, aren't you?
It's broken?! Argh, you've got to be kidding!
You can report your own failures.
You expect me to believe such madness?
Broken. We meddled in these paltry affairs, and for what?
I... yes. It will be so.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Nere reacts to a brief mindmeld while maintaining the spell at the ready, then regains his composure

Text.Value: There is another way, though - we have allies on the surface. Seek them out, and play this lyre to call on their guide.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: stows the moon lantern back where he kept it

Text.Value: What's going on? What have you done?
Important business. My orders come from General Thorm himself.
The Moonlantern's broken? Just our luck.
As for the rest of you slave-worms - you've caused enough trouble.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Nere rears back to cast a spell at the remaining gnomes

Text.Value: No. You have a trick - an enchantment. If it can protect you, it'll protect me. All I have to do is take it.

EditorData.NodeContext: You're about to attack the player

Text.Value: It's you, it must be. You've done something to anger Her.
If that's the case, how do I reach it safely?
I'll do it. Where can I find the General?
I haven't done anything, but I don't hear Her either.
Your faith in Lolth faltered. It is not too late to reclaim it.
It cannot be. Have I betrayed Lolth for an impostor?
Take this - a personal blessing. I pray we don't meet again.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Generic item hand-off below camera - item TBD

Text.Value: This was meant to be a simple operation - I arrive, those pack animals clear the debris, and I walk into the temple.
Cast Detect Thoughts.
The Absolute is no mere cult - it is a calling. And you are here to test my faith.

EditorData.NodeContext: Last sentence grim and determined - about to attack

Text.Value: I had a Moonlantern to keep the curse at bay. Alas, the rocks did it in.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Pulls out a broken moonlantern to show you

Text.Value: I'd rather make my own way than rely on your help.
First tell me what happened to this place.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Nere fires the spell and the gnomes are dead.
EditorData.SFXTags: SFX_Spell - Casting the spell to kill

Text.Value: Whoever sent you isn't going to be very happy.
Was I so weak as to betray the Weaver?
But I know you are a traitor - and I will show no mercy!
Damn it. So much for using that thing to protect us.

EditorData.NodeContext: Exasperated. Some special equipment the party went out of their way to retrieve is broken beyond repair.

Text.Value: The General? Is he a favourite of the Absolute?
Minthara? I'm surprised she hasn't got herself killed on one of her reckless raids.
Gnomes, you are slaves no longer. The Absolute may have use for you yet.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Nere lowers his arm and enters default speaking position. Addressed to remaining gnomes

EditorData.stateContext: Nere has readied his spell and is prepared to attack.

Text.Value: Do not tarry. I will see you again, but only when my work is done.
I owe you a debt. And I would hate to be ungrateful.
I'll pick up his trail and follow him. Prove myself his superior.
This is not a failure, it's only a setback. I have been entrusted with a sacred mission - I cannot fail.
I will take word to the Order of Soul Spiders. They must know of the Absolute threat.
You traitorous little maggot!
Liar. I've seen no such creatures.
Fool. My mind is not your playground.
You would be wiser to align yourself with me than her. Few earn the General's favour - I am sure to be among them.
What are you talking about? I can hear Her just fine.
Say nothing.
You're right. I'm a fool for not seeing it before now.

EditorData.NodeContext: Ashamed but mostly angry that he was deceived

Text.Value: And what business is that, exactly?
Whatever you do - do not attempt the journey to Moonrise without his protection. I promise you, it will not end well.
A broken Moonlantern? They say that's ten years of bad luck.
I - I don't understand. I've been following those wretched beasts?
You don't deserve the death you got. I should have made it last.
Go ahead - try it.
All right, I'll tell the General what happened here.
I don't know what you are, that you can defy the Absolute's will.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Nere reacts to a brief mindmeld while maintaining the spell at the ready, then frowns at the player before delivering his line

Text.Value: Of course they did. Why would anything go our way?
Unfortunate - but how does this concern me?

EditorData.stateContext: Nere is in default state, no spell readied.

Text.Value: Abandon the Absolute? After everything I've done for Her? Everything She's done for me?
The Absolute should be demanding I take your head for insolence like that, but I can't hear Her voice.
People have followed cults for a long time. You're just another victim.
Attack Nere.
He never mentioned this.
Forget it. I was merely testing your faith.
You insolent worm. You would refuse Nere? Refuse the Absolute?
Instead, I've been beset by incompetence, treachery, and now this. The Absolute's business remains unfinished.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: On 'this' he gestures to the broken bridge in front of him.

Text.Value: I owe you a debt, it seems. You've saved me from worse than the duergar.
I need you to deliver a message to him. Tell the General that I did what I could, but that the route through Grymforge is impassable.
If you survived, I'm sure I will.
Let it be done.
If you won't help me, I may as well enjoy this.

Synopsis: After fighting and killing a group of duergar servants that mutinied against him, Nere takes his rage and frustration out on one of their bodies by kicking it. Once he's done, he takes the players to a nearby broken bridge and explains that he needs reinforcements. The player can promise they'll inform his boss - Chosen Ketheric - or not.
